nodes.name: Pallet Town
nodes.description: Starting town where you choose your first Pokemon and receive the Pokedex

nodes.name: Choose a Pokemon
nodes.description: Select your starter Pokemon

nodes.name: Deliver Prof. Oak's Parcel and get a Pokedex
nodes.description: Bring Prof. Oak's Parcel to him in exchange for a Pokedex

nodes.name: Pick up the Town Map
nodes.description: Obtain the Town Map from your rival's sister

nodes.name: Pokedex
nodes.howToGet: Deliver Prof. Oak's Parcel to Prof. Oak

nodes.name: Route 1
nodes.description: Route connecting Pallet Town to Viridian City

nodes.name: Pick up Oak's Parcel
nodes.description: Get Oak's Parcel from the clerk at the Poke Mart in Viridian City

nodes.name: Return to Prof. Oak
nodes.description: Return to Prof. Oak and receive a reward

nodes.name: Get Town Map
nodes.description: Pick up a Town Map from your rival's sister

nodes.name: Oak's Parcel
nodes.howToGet: Get from the clerk at the Poke Mart in Viridian City

nodes.name: HM 05
nodes.howToGet: Pick up on the other side of the tree in Route 1

nodes.name: Defeat Giovanni at Viridian Gym
nodes.description: Battle Giovanni, leader of Team Rocket, at the Viridian Gym

nodes.name: Get the Earth Badge
nodes.description: Obtain the Earth Badge from the Viridian Gym

nodes.name: Route 22
nodes.description: A route near Viridian City with long grasses for Pokemon hunting and where your Rival lurks

nodes.name: Capture Wild Pokemon
nodes.description: Hunt in the long grasses for low-level Pokemon

nodes.name: Battle Your Rival
nodes.description: Challenge your Rival who is waiting along the path

nodes.name: At least two Pokemon trained to LV 9 or above
Route 2
nodes.description: A route connecting various locations with multiple buildings and access to Viridian Forest and Diglett's Cave

nodes.name: Trade an Abra for a Mr. Mime
nodes.description: Visit the house on Route 2 and trade your Abra with the person inside for their Mr. Mime

nodes.name: Get HM 05
nodes.description: Visit the building and talk to the people inside who will give you HM 05 if you have captured 10 Pokemon

nodes.name: HM 05 (Flash)
nodes.howToGet: Talk to people in building after capturing 10 Pokemon

nodes.name: Defeat Brock at the Gym
nodes.description: Battle the first Gym Leader who specializes in Rock and Ground Pokemon

nodes.name: Get the Old Amber from the Museum's research facility
nodes.description: Obtain the Old Amber from the Museum research facility

nodes.name: Boulder Badge
nodes.howToGet: Defeat Brock at the Pewter City Gym

nodes.name: TM 34
nodes.howToGet: Reward for defeating Brock at the Pewter City Gym

nodes.name: Old Amber
nodes.howToGet: Get from the Museum's research facility after learning Cut ability

nodes.name: Pikachu
nodes.notes: Found in nearby woods, won't find one very often

nodes.name: Route 4
nodes.description: A route west of Mt. Moon with long grass, leading to Cerulean City. No trainers present but has wild Pokemon and items.

nodes.name: TM 04 (Whirlwind)
nodes.howToGet: Found on the second set of plateaus

nodes.name: Ekans
nodes.notes: First unique Pokemon for Red version

nodes.name: Sandshrew
nodes.notes: First unique Pokemon for Blue version

nodes.name: Kingler
nodes.notes: Available by fishing at Seafoam Islands

nodes.name: Route 25
nodes.description: Route containing Pokemon House and items

nodes.name: Investigate Silph Co.
nodes.description: Take a look around Silph Co. as it is the source of problems

nodes.name: Visit the Fighting Gym
nodes.description: Go to the Fighting Pokemon gym to get your choice of rare Fighting Pokemon as a prize

nodes.name: Route 6
nodes.description: Route 6 connecting area with wild Pokemon encounters

nodes.name: Vermilion City
nodes.description: City with Electric-type Gym led by Lt. Surge, home to S.S. Anne and Pokemon Fan Club

nodes.name: Get HM 01 (Cut) from the Captain of the S.S. Anne
nodes.description: Visit the Captain on the S.S. Anne to obtain Cut ability

nodes.name: Defeat Lt. Surge at the Gym
nodes.description: Figure out the code to unlock the door by defeating Junior Trainers, then look in garbage bins to find electrical locks

nodes.name: Talk to the President of the Pokemon Fan Club
nodes.description: Visit the Pokemon Fan Club President

nodes.name: Trade a Spearow for a FarFetch'd
nodes.description: Find trader willing to exchange rare FarFetch'd for common Spearow

nodes.name: Get the Old Rod from the Fishing Guru
nodes.description: Obtain fishing rod from Fishing Guru

nodes.name: HM 01 (Cut)
nodes.howToGet: Obtained from Captain of S.S. Anne

nodes.name: TM 24 (Thunderbolt)
nodes.howToGet: Given by Lt. Surge after defeating him

nodes.name: Magikarp
nodes.notes: Can be caught with Old Rod

nodes.name: FarFetch'd
nodes.notes: Obtained by trading Spearow to trainer

nodes.name: Get Bike Voucher from Pokemon Fan Club
nodes.description: Listen to the president talk about his rare Pokemon (especially Rapidash) and he'll give you his Bike Voucher

nodes.name: Get Old Rod
nodes.description: Talk to the Fishing Guru of Vermilion City

nodes.name: Get Itemfinder
nodes.description: Collect 30 Pokemon and talk to Prof. Oak's Aide

nodes.name: Itemfinder
nodes.howToGet: Get from Prof. Oak's Aide after collecting 30 Pokemon

nodes.name: Route 9
nodes.description: Route connecting to Rock Tunnel with a stream accessible via Surf leading to Power Plant

nodes.name: Explore upstream with Surf
nodes.description: Use Surf ability to explore the stream north of the Pokemon Center to reach the abandoned Power Plant

nodes.name: Navigate Rock Tunnel
nodes.description: Use Flash skill to illuminate the dark Rock Tunnel and find your way through to the other side

nodes.name: Route 10
nodes.description: Route connecting Rock Tunnel to Lavender Town

nodes.name: Free the restless ghost
nodes.description: Use the Silph Scope to free the restless ghost

nodes.name: Rescue Mr. Fuji
nodes.description: Rescue Mr. Fuji from the top of Pokemon Tower and get the Poke Flute

nodes.name: Defeat Misty
nodes.description: Defeat Misty at the Cerulean City Gym to get the Cascade Badge

nodes.name: Revive
nodes.howToGet: Purchase at Lavender City Poke Mart for 1,500P

nodes.name: Poke Flute
nodes.howToGet: Rescue Mr. Fuji from Pokemon Tower

nodes.name: Defeat Koga at the Fuchsia City Gym
nodes.description: Battle and defeat Koga to get the Soul Badge

nodes.name: Get HM 03 and Gold teeth in Safari Zone
nodes.description: Pick up HM 03 and the Gold teeth items in the Safari Zone

nodes.name: Exchange Gold teeth for HM 04
nodes.description: Trade the Gold teeth with the Game Warden for HM 04

nodes.name: Climb to the top of the tower
nodes.description: Navigate through the tall tower to reach the top and determine the cause of the mayhem

nodes.name: Soul Badge
nodes.howToGet: Defeat Koga at the Fuchsia City Gym

nodes.name: HM 03
nodes.howToGet: Pick up in the Safari Zone

nodes.name: Gold teeth
nodes.howToGet: Pick up in the Safari Zone

nodes.name: HM 04
nodes.howToGet: Exchange the Gold teeth with the Game Warden

nodes.name: Route 8
nodes.description: Route connecting Lavender Town to Saffron City

nodes.name: Give drink to guard
nodes.description: Give the thirsty guard a drink

nodes.name: Route 7
nodes.description: A route with nine trainers that provides experience boost before entering Celadon City

nodes.name: Battle trainers for experience
nodes.description: Fight the nine trainers on the route to gain experience before entering Celadon City

nodes.name: Access Underground Path
nodes.description: Use the house north of the Saffron City gatehouse to enter the east-west Underground Path

nodes.name: Defeat the Head of the Fighting Dojo
nodes.description: Battle the leader at the Fighting Dojo

nodes.name: Clear Team Rocket from the city
Rescue the President of Silph Co. and get the Master Ball
nodes.description: Navigate the 11-floor Silph Co. building and rescue the company president from Team Rocket

nodes.name: Clear Team Rocket from Silph Co.
Defeat Sabrina at the Saffron City Gym
nodes.description: Use teleport pads to navigate the Gym and defeat Sabrina with Bug or Ghost Pokemon

nodes.name: Marsh Badge
nodes.howToGet: Defeat Sabrina at the Saffron City Gym

nodes.name: TM 31 (Mimic)
nodes.howToGet: Give a Poke Doll to the little girl

nodes.name: TM 46 (Psywave)
nodes.howToGet: Defeat Sabrina at the Saffron City Gym

nodes.name: Master Ball
nodes.howToGet: Rescue the President of Silph Co.

nodes.name: Hitmonlee or Hitmonchan
nodes.notes: Obtained from Fighting Dojo (choice between the two)

nodes.name: Defeat Erika in the Celadon City Gym
nodes.description: Battle the Gym Leader to earn the Rainbow Badge

nodes.name: Get the Rainbow Badge
nodes.description: Obtain badge by defeating Erika

nodes.name: Get the Silph Scope
nodes.description: Obtain from Team Rocket Hideout beneath the Game Corner by defeating Giovanni

nodes.name: Buy a Soda Pop
nodes.description: Purchase from vending machines on rooftop of Celadon Dept. Store

nodes.name: Rainbow Badge
nodes.howToGet: Defeat Erika in Celadon City Gym

nodes.name: Silph Scope
nodes.howToGet: Defeat Giovanni in Team Rocket Hideout beneath Game Corner

nodes.name: Lift Key
nodes.howToGet: Talk to defeated Team Rocket member in hideout

nodes.name: Route 16
nodes.description: A steep cycling road with a Snorlax blocking the path and bikers stationed along the route

nodes.name: Wake the Snorlax
nodes.description: Use the Poke Flute to wake up the Snorlax blocking the road and capture it

nodes.name: Get HM 02 Fly
nodes.description: Use Cut ability to clear the bush before Snorlax, go to northern gatehouse, visit house where little girl gives HM 02

nodes.name: Get Exp. All from Prof. Oak's Aide
nodes.description: Collect 50 Pokemon to receive Exp. All research equipment that shares experience points among party

nodes.name: HM 02 (Fly)
nodes.howToGet: Clear bush with Cut, go to northern gatehouse, get from little girl in house

nodes.name: Exp. All
nodes.howToGet: Get from Prof. Oak's Aide after collecting 50 Pokemon

nodes.name: Snorlax
nodes.notes: Only two in the game, blocks the road until awakened with Poke Flute

nodes.name: Route 17
nodes.description: Part of Cycling Road leading to Route 18 and Fuchsia City

nodes.name: Trade for Lickitung
nodes.description: Trade a Slowbro for a Lickitung with a person on the top floor of the gatehouse between Cycling Road and Fuchsia City

nodes.name: Get the Good Rod
nodes.description: Obtain the Good Rod from the Fishing Guru's House

nodes.name: Get HM 04 from the Game Warden
nodes.description: Obtain HM 04 (Strength) from the Game Warden's House

nodes.name: Visit the Safari Zone
nodes.description: Pay 500P admission to enter Safari Zone with 30 Safari Balls

nodes.name: Win Safari Zone contest
nodes.description: Make it to the house in the northwest corner of Area 3 before time runs out to win HM 03 (Surf)

nodes.name: HM 03 (Surf)
nodes.howToGet: Win Safari Zone contest by reaching house in northwest corner of Area 3

nodes.name: Route 13
nodes.description: A stretch of road with patches of land where it's easy to capture wild second forms of Pokemon

nodes.name: Hunt for evolved Pokemon
nodes.description: Hunt in the thickets for advanced Pokemon like Pidgeotto, Gloom, and Weepinbell to save time leveling up their first forms

nodes.name: Route 12
nodes.description: A route connecting to Lavender Town with fishing opportunities and a Snorlax blocking the road

nodes.name: Wake up Snorlax
nodes.description: Use the Poke Flute to wake the sleeping Snorlax blocking the road, then battle and potentially capture it

nodes.name: Get Super Rod
nodes.description: Talk to the fisherman to learn about fishing lore and receive a Super Rod

nodes.name: Super Rod
nodes.howToGet: Talk to the fisherman who will teach you fishing lore

nodes.name: Route 19
nodes.description: A watery road ruled by Swimmers and Beauties

nodes.name: Defeat Gym Leader Koga
nodes.description: Navigate invisible walls and defeat Koga's Poison/Psychic Pokemon using strong offensive fighters and Full Heals

nodes.name: Catch Articuno
nodes.description: Navigate to bottom of Seafoam Islands, save game, whittle HP down carefully, use Ultra Balls when HP is very low

nodes.name: Calm the current in Seafoam Islands
nodes.description: Push three boulders down holes to the bottom floor to slow the fast current

nodes.name: Ultra Ball
nodes.howToGet: Purchase at Safari Zone shop for 1,200P

nodes.name: Full Heal
nodes.howToGet: Purchase at Safari Zone shop for 600P

nodes.name: Articuno
nodes.notes: Legendary Pokemon at LV 50 in Seafoam Islands, very difficult to catch

nodes.name: Route 21
nodes.description: A route with trainers that can be avoided by hugging the left wall, connects to other areas including Pallet Town

nodes.name: Catch Tangela
nodes.description: Hunt in the plot of grass south of Pallet Town where Tangela can only be found

nodes.name: Access Route 23 and Victory Road
nodes.description: Walk through the doors at the end of Route 22 to reach Route 23 and Victory Road

nodes.name: Tangela
nodes.notes: Found only in the plot of grass south of Pallet Town

nodes.name: Indigo Plateau
nodes.description: Final location where you defeat the Elite Four and your Rival to become Pokemon Champion

nodes.name: Defeat the Elite Four
nodes.description: Defeat the Site Four, one right after another

nodes.name: Defeat your Rival one last time
nodes.description: Face your Rival in the final battle

nodes.name: Become the Master Pokemon Trainer
nodes.description: Complete the final challenges to achieve master status

nodes.name: Find Jigglypuff
nodes.description: Search the long grass before entering Mt. Moon for a Jigglypuff

nodes.name: Choose Fossil
nodes.description: Choose between Dome Fossil or Helix Fossil

nodes.name: Take fossils to Scientist
nodes.description: Let the Scientist look at fossils to revive them

nodes.name: Pokemon Tower
nodes.description: Multi-floor tower with floors 5F and 7F mentioned

nodes.name: Rhyhorn
nodes.notes: Found in Main Zone and Area 2

nodes.name: Parasect
nodes.notes: Found in Main Zone and Area 1

nodes.name: Scyther
nodes.notes: Found in Main Zone and Area 1

nodes.name: Pinsir
nodes.notes: Found in Main Zone and Area 1

nodes.name: Chansey
nodes.notes: Found in Main Zone and Area 2

nodes.name: Golbat
nodes.notes: Won't stop draining energy from victim even if it gets too heavy to fly

nodes.name: Seel
nodes.notes: Protruding horn on head is very hard and used for bashing through thick ice

nodes.name: Resurrect fossils at Pokemon Lab
nodes.description: Take fossils to the Pokemon Lab for resurrection

nodes.name: Get Secret Key from Pokemon House
nodes.description: Navigate the abandoned Pokemon House and retrieve the Secret Key from the basement by jumping from third floor

nodes.name: Defeat Blaine at Cinnabar Island Gym
nodes.description: Find the hidden key, fight through trainers, and defeat gym leader Blaine using Water or Ground/Rock Pokemon

nodes.name: Secret Key
nodes.howToGet: Found in basement of Pokemon House - jump from third floor open area near Scientist

nodes.name: TM 38 (Fire Blast)
nodes.howToGet: Received from Blaine after defeating him

nodes.name: Navigate to Elite Four
nodes.description: Use stairs A, B, and C to reach the exit

nodes.name: Catch Moltres
nodes.description: Take detour to stairs D and E to reach Moltres' lair, weaken and capture using same techniques as Articuno

nodes.name: Solve boulder puzzles
nodes.description: Push boulders over pressure plates to hold stone doors open

nodes.name: Moltres
nodes.notes: Legendary Flame Bird, as hard to catch as Articuno

nodes.name: Capture Zapdos
nodes.description: Find Zapdos right before the exit of the Power Plant and capture using same techniques as other legendary birds

nodes.name: Battle Rival
nodes.description: Fight against Rival's well-rounded team with representatives of all major groups

nodes.name: Poke Ball or Voltorb
nodes.howToGet: Pick up items found throughout the Power Plant, but some may actually be Voltorb Pokemon

nodes.name: Electric Pokemon
nodes.notes: Ton of Electric Pokemon found inside

nodes.name: Zapdos
nodes.notes: Legendary Electric Bird, third of the Bird Trio, found right before the exit

requirements: Cut skill to slice down saplings
Defeat Brock at Pewter City Gym
Cannot return once you enter the long grass
